title: Welcome to My Website
text:
Hello! My name is Celeste Tan Jia Yu, and this is my personal website. Explore the tabs above to learn about my projects, more about me, and my reflections.



I am currently a Year 2 Applied Computing in FinTech student at the Singapore Institute of Technology. Before this, I was at Republic Polytechnic, studying Financial Technology. I am passionate about the potential of FinTech to transform the financial industry and am eager to continuously enhance my skills and knowledge in this dynamic field.
In my free time, I enjoy: - Reading - Hiking - Volunteering
Helping others makes me happy because many people helped my family when I was younger. I’m grateful for that and want to do the same for others. Additionally, I also enjoy participating in competitions to strengthen and broaden my skills.
At the end of the day, I aspire to be proud of how far I have come by always working hard to be the best version of myself.

title: Who Am I?
text:
Who Am I?
My name is Celeste Tan Jia Yu, and I am passionate about data science, technology, and storytelling. I enjoy working on projects that make data insights accessible to everyone.



Technical Skills
Computer Maintenance and System Administration - Proficient in computer maintenance and system administration tasks. - Operating Systems: Ubuntu (Linux)
Networking - LAN and Wireless networking expertise. - Cisco Packet Tracer for network simulation.
Programming Languages - Advanced Java - Python (Wing IDE) - .NET (Visual Studio) - JavaScript - MySQL - C# (Visual Studio) - Solidity (blockchain development)
Database Programs - Proficient in managing databases using MySQL and Oracle Database.
Networking Programs - Experienced in network analysis using Wireshark. - Cisco Packet Tracer for network simulation.
Virtualization - Experience with VMware virtualization.
MS Office Suite - MS Word - MS Excel - MS PowerPoint
Methodology - SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) - BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation) - UML (Unified Modeling Language) - Agile methodology - RAD (Rapid Application Development)
Software Packages - SAS (Statistical Analysis System)



Achievements

2023: Octava Foundation Scholar
2022: Director’s Roll of Honour
2022: Top 10 Finalist of the iDare Entrepreneurial Challenge 2022 (December to February)
2021 – 2022: Participant of EMPOWER AI for Girls (10 Sessions from October to February)
2021: Participant of the PolyFintech Hackathon 2021
2019 – 2020: Howe Yoon Chong PSA Scholarship
2019 – 2020: Chip Eng Seng Grant
2019: Participant for Girls Capture the Flag Competition

title: Projects
text:
Role: Member
Skills: C language
Year: 2023
Collaborated with a dynamic team to develop a comprehensive Clinic Appointment Scheduling System using both ArrayList and LinkedList data structures to assess their comparative performance. The system provides users with efficient management capabilities, allowing for operations such as: - Displaying all appointments - Inserting new appointments - Querying specific appointments - Updating appointment details - Deleting appointments - Saving appointment data to a file
Robust error-handling mechanisms are integrated to ensure a reliable user experience. The user-friendly interface enhances the overall experience, ensuring smooth navigation through various functionalities.







Role: Leader
Skills: Python (Selenium, BeautifulSoup, Pandas, CustomTkinter, Matplotlib, CSV, etc.)
Year: 2023
Collaborated with a dynamic team to develop a comprehensive HDB property analysis GUI. The application not only provides insightful data analytics but also simplifies the property selection process through efficient web scraping, offering users a multifaceted tool for well-informed decision-making.
Key Features: - Predictive pricing models: Users can forecast property prices. - Interactive data analytics charts: Provide a visual understanding of market trends. - Export charts in PNG format: Enhances user convenience.







Role: Member of the FYP team
Skills: Java, Firebase, JavaScript, Spring Boot, Google Chrome Extension Development
Year: 2022
Led weekly sessions with my FYP team from April 18 to August 2 to address the rising threat of internet phishing links. My team developed a web application utilizing a Google Chrome Extension, providing users with a safeguard against phishing scams. Despite the challenges, our project excelled, securing a spot among the top two projects in the cohort.
